author: CHRIS ISEMAN
title: Giants notes: Beckham remains day to day - Sports
text:
Odell Beckham Jr. did not practice Thursday as he continues to recover from a hamstring injury he suffered in Sunday’s win over San Francisco. Coach Tom Coughlin said the wide receiver is day to day.
Although Beckham didn’t practice, he did extra stretching with a trainer and some light jogging. He was optimistic that he’ll be ready to play Monday night in Philadelphia.
“Treatment, treatment, treatment,” Beckham said. “Just make sure you stay on top of it all and come out prepared for Monday.”
Beckham also responded to an off-the-field issue.Last week, Jets cornerback Antonio Cromartie called Beckham a “one-year wonder” during an interview. But
Beckham wasn’t bothered by the comments.
“I’m not really worried about what anybody else has to say, who’s not on the Giants,” Beckham said. “Doesn’t motivate me. No effect.”
Troublesome’ injuries 
The Giants made some significant adjustments to their practice schedule this season to prevent injuries, but Thursday’s injury list included 11 players.
“All these soft-tissue injuries are very, very troublesome, occurring in games, if you will,” Coughlin said. “And then being so long and trying to get people back. I’m not going to get frustrated by it, but it’s very bothersome.”
The Giants with soft-tissue injuries included defensive end Robert Ayers (hamstring), Beckham (hamstring), linebacker Jonathan Casillas (calf), linebacker Devon Kennard (hamstring), cornerback Trumaine McBride (groin), wide receiver Rueben Randle (hamstring) and defensive end George Selvie (calf).
Ayers, McBride, Randle and Selvie were limited participants in Thursday’s practice. Wide receiver Victor Cruz (calf), linebacker Jon Beason (concussion), Casillas and Kennard did not practice.
Randle injured his hamstring Sunday against San Francisco, but said Thursday it felt better as the game progressed.
“It’s a little sore now, but it’s getting better,” Randle said. “As long as I’m progressing, I’m pretty positive.”
Despite the number of injuries, Coughlin said he’s not planning to adjust the practice schedule.
“It’s not a time to change now. For years we did it one way, we’re doing it this way, we’re going to stay with it,” Coughlin said. “We’re going to see how it goes.”
Briefs 
Coughlin said he did not have an updated timetable on Cruz. … Guard Justin Pugh (ankle) was a full participant in Thursday’s practice.
